content.question: Which of the following is true of the relationship between Congress and executive agencies?

choices.label: The agencies were created by and work under the direction of Congress.
Agencies, once created, work totally independent of Congress.
Because the agencies have bureaucratic expertise, Congress delegates “rulemaking authority” to them.
Because of differing objectives, their relationships are always adversarial.
Congress creates, staffs, and supervises all executive agencies.

content.answer: Because the agencies have bureaucratic expertise, Congress delegates “rulemaking authority” to them.
